results.description: Combine competitor average returns to capture short-term momentum spillovers. Applied SUGGESTION1 by using rel_ret_comp; SUGGESTION2 N/A (field scalar); SUGGESTION3 N/A (coverage 0.8228 > 0.6); SUGGESTION4: rel_ret_comp has high user/alpha counts so chosen. Kept implementation short per KEEP_IN_MINDs. Confidence set to 0.72.

Identify instruments whose competitors recently spiked and expect mean-reversion. Used rel_ret_comp (high coverage) only for simplicity (SUGGESTION1 not applied to avoid overfitting). SUGGESTION3 N/A. Implementation concise. Confidence 0.60.

Use sign of customer returns to infer demand-driven direction. SUGGESTION1 limited to pv13_custretsig_retsig (single, but strong coverage 0.9276). SUGGESTION2 N/A. SUGGESTION3 N/A. Keep implementation minimal. Confidence 0.65.

Customer network centrality averaged to represent influence-weighted demand. Applied SUGGESTION2 by treating pv13_ustomergraphrank_page_rank as vector and using vec_avg(). SUGGESTION3 N/A (coverage 0.7906). SUGGESTION1 used single vector field as most informative. Confidence 0.70.

Exploit rising competitor authority scores indicating shifting industry leadership. Used pv13_com_rk_au (high coverage) with time-series zscore. SUGGESTION1 single-field choice for clarity. Confidence 0.66.

Rank instruments cross-sectionally by competitor hub score to capture structural network advantage. Used pv13_ompetitorgraphrank_hub_rank (coverage 0.8966). SUGGESTION2 N/A. Applied quantile for cross-sectional mapping per KEEP_IN_MIND. Confidence 0.62.

Scale competitor returns by competitor market cap to prefer meaningful moves. Applied SUGGESTION1 using rel_ret_comp and pv13_revere_index_cap. Both have high counts. SUGGESTION3 N/A. Operators kept below limit. Confidence 0.74.
Firms with many partners may propagate shocks; use rel_num_part to detect momentum effects. SUGGESTION1 single-field due to clarity; rel_num_part coverage 0.7837 so SUGGESTION3 N/A. Confidence 0.58.
Use rel_num_comp (competitor count) to detect crowded competitive spaces that amplify moves. SUGGESTION1 single-field; coverage 0.8902 high so no backfill. Confidence 0.55.
Average returns of all related companies (rel_ret_all) to capture group-level momentum. SUGGESTION1 used rel_ret_all (high coverage 0.9613) only; SUGGESTION2 N/A. Confidence 0.76.

Neutralize rel_ret_comp by country group to remove country effects. SUGGESTION1 applied using rel_ret_comp and pv13_revere_country as group; SUGGESTION4 applied (fields high counts). KEEP_IN_MIND4 followed by using group_neutralize. Confidence 0.68.

Long firms whose customers' PageRank rises while competitors' PageRank falls. SUGGESTION1 used vec_avg(pv13_ustomergraphrank_page_rank) and pv13_com_page_rank. SUGGESTION2 applied to customer PageRank vector. Both coverages high. Confidence 0.71.
Detect unexpected moves in partners' returns (rel_ret_part) as leading signal. SUGGESTION1 uses rel_ret_part only (coverage 0.7097). SUGGESTION3 N/A. Confidence 0.59.
High rel_num_all indicates crowding; expect mean reversion after large moves. SUGGESTION1 used rel_num_all (coverage 0.9939) with recent rel_ret_all. Both high count. Confidence 0.64.
Focus on instruments whose competitors are small (pv13_revere_index_cap low) but have rising returns. SUGGESTION1 used rel_ret_comp and pv13_revere_index_cap. SUGGESTION4 satisfied. Confidence 0.67.

When averaged customer returns spike positively, short-term contrarian positions may work. Used rel_ret_cust but coverage 0.4921 < 0.6 so applied SUGGESTION3 ts_backfill. SUGGESTION2 N/A. Confidence 0.50.
Detect accelerating authority increases in competitors (pv13_com_rk_au) to capture leadership shifts. SUGGESTION1 single-field; SUGGESTION3 N/A. Confidence 0.63.

Weight competitor returns by their PageRank so influential competitors drive signal. Applied SUGGESTION1 using pv13_com_page_rank and rel_ret_comp. SUGGESTION2 N/A. Kept simple division/multiply. Confidence 0.75.
Firms with many key sectors (pv13_revere_key_sector_total) expanding quickly may outperform. SUGGESTION1 single-field due to strong coverage 1.0. Confidence 0.57.
Companies concentrated in terminal sectors (pv13_revere_term_sector_total) may have clearer growth patterns. Used single field with ts_zscore. Coverage 1.0 so SUGGESTION3 N/A. Confidence 0.52.

results.idea: Customer hub vs competitor hub divergence
results.description: Contrast customers' hub scores with competitors' hub scores to find shifting influence. SUGGESTION1 uses pv13_ustomergraphrank_hub_rank and pv13_ompetitorgraphrank_hub_rank. SUGGESTION2 N/A. Confidence 0.68.
Rank instruments by recent competitor returns across universe to capture cross-sectional leaders. SUGGESTION1 single-field rel_ret_comp; used quantile for cross-sectional mapping. Confidence 0.73.
Use stddev of customer PageRank vector to detect unstable customer bases (vec_stddev). SUGGESTION2 applied to pv13_ustomergraphrank_page_rank. SUGGESTION3 N/A. Confidence 0.61.
Scale competitor returns by competitor count (rel_num_comp) to avoid tiny-sample noise. SUGGESTION1 applied with two fields, both high coverage. Confidence 0.69.
Use time-series IR on customer returns to detect persistent trends. SUGGESTION1 single-field rel_ret_cust but coverage low so applied ts_backfill per SUGGESTION3. Confidence 0.56.
Cross-sectional zscore of competitor PageRank to find structurally improving firms. SUGGESTION1 used pv13_com_page_rank (high user/alpha counts). KEEP_IN_MIND2 satisfied. Confidence 0.64.
High IR of partners' returns (rel_ret_part) signals sustained partner-driven trends. SUGGESTION1 single-field; coverage OK (0.7097). Confidence 0.60.
High dispersion among competitors' returns implies idiosyncratic opportunity; use ts_std_dev on rel_ret_comp. SUGGESTION1 single-field chosen. Confidence 0.62.

Neutralize customer-return signal by country to remove macro-country moves. SUGGESTION1 used rel_ret_cust + pv13_revere_country as group; rel_ret_cust backfilled due to coverage <0.6. KEEP_IN_MIND4 applied. Confidence 0.58.
Detect rapid increases in competitors' hub scores indicating rising influence. SUGGESTION1 used pv13_ompetitorgraphrank_hub_rank. Confidence 0.61.
Weight partner returns by partners' PageRank to highlight influential partner moves. SUGGESTION1 used rel_ret_part and pv13_com_page_rank; both high coverage. Confidence 0.70.

Use pv13_revere_key_sector_total as group to compute group mean of rel_ret_all to detect sector contagion. SUGGESTION1 used two fields; KEEP_IN_MIND4 used pv13_revere_key_sector_total as group. Confidence 0.66.

Spread between averaged customer returns and competitor returns shows demand vs competition. SUGGESTION1 used rel_ret_cust (backfilled) and rel_ret_comp. Applied SUGGESTION3 to rel_ret_cust. Confidence 0.63.
Cross-sectional quantile of pv13_com_page_rank to isolate network breakout names. SUGGESTION1 single-field; high counts used. Confidence 0.65.
Scale partner-count change by its historical range to find abnormal expansions. SUGGESTION1 single-field rel_num_part; used ts_scale to normalize. Confidence 0.54.
Compare present rel_ret_comp to its 5-day lag to capture acceleration. SUGGESTION1 single-field; used ts_delta operator. Confidence 0.59.
Difference between competitor HITS authority and PageRank to spot topology changes. SUGGESTION1 used pv13_com_rk_au and pv13_com_page_rank. Both high coverage. Confidence 0.62.
Use count of customers (rel_num_cust) to detect expanding customer bases; coverage <0.6 so applied ts_backfill. SUGGESTION2 N/A. Confidence 0.48.
Long names where competitor authority rises while competitor returns lag — leader emergence. SUGGESTION1 used pv13_com_rk_au and rel_ret_comp. Both high coverage. Confidence 0.67.
Divide competitor PageRank by pv13_revere_company_total to control for sector breadth (coverage low 0.3508 so ts_backfill applied). SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.55.
Use ts_decay_linear on backfilled rel_ret_cust to capture persistent customer-driven alpha. SUGGESTION3 applied to rel_ret_cust. Confidence 0.57.
High rel_num_comp with extreme rel_ret_comp suggests contrarian entry. Used both fields per SUGGESTION1. Confidence 0.61.
Scale vec_avg customer PageRank by its time-series zscore to find accelerating client influence. SUGGESTION2 applied. Confidence 0.66.
Average partner returns (rel_ret_part) cross-sectionally normalized to detect partner-driven sentiment. SUGGESTION1 single-field; used quantile. Confidence 0.58.
Use inverse of ts_std_dev(rel_ret_comp) to prefer stable competitor environments. SUGGESTION1 single-field. Confidence 0.53.
Use sign of customer return (pv13_custretsig_retsig) as a filter on other alpha (rel_ret_comp) to trade only aligned names. SUGGESTION1 used two fields; SUGGESTION3 N/A. Confidence 0.69.
Cross-sectional ranking of pv13_com_rk_au to find leaders. SUGGESTION1 single-field; used quantile. Confidence 0.63.

Compare vec_avg customer PageRank to number of key sectors (pv13_revere_key_sector_total) to find focused but influential firms. SUGGESTION1 used two fields; SUGGESTION2 applied to customer PageRank. Confidence 0.68.

results.idea: Competitor return momentum vs sector median
results.description: Cross-sectional normalize rel_ret_comp within sector group to capture idiosyncratic competitor moves. SUGGESTION1 used group_neutralize with pv13_revere_key_sector_total. Confidence 0.71.

results.idea: Partner return surprise scaled by partner count
results.description: Divide recent rel_ret_part by rel_num_part to prefer meaningful partner moves. SUGGESTION1 applied with two fields. Confidence 0.65.
Use ts_count_nans on competitor PageRank (if sparse) to avoid low-coverage names, but field coverage high so not needed. SUGGESTION3 N/A. Confidence 0.50.
Rank-of-change in pv13_com_rk_au over 20 days to capture emerging authorities. SUGGESTION1 single-field. Confidence 0.60.

results.idea: Customer hub vs competitor return cross-spread
results.description: Spread between vec_avg customer hub rank and competitor returns to find demand-outperform names. SUGGESTION1 applied; SUGGESTION2 used for customer hub vector. Confidence 0.67.
Rapid increase in rel_num_comp could signal market entry or disruption. SUGGESTION1 single-field; used ts_delta. Confidence 0.54.

After large sector index move (pv13_revere_index_value), identify names whose competitor PageRank increases. SUGGESTION1 used pv13_revere_index_value and pv13_com_page_rank. Both high coverage. Confidence 0.62.

Scale customer returns by company market cap to prefer impactful customer-driven moves. SUGGESTION1 used rel_ret_cust (backfilled) and pv13_revere_index_cap. Applied SUGGESTION3 to rel_ret_cust. Confidence 0.59.
Use ts_decay_linear on rel_ret_comp to emphasize recent competitor moves. SUGGESTION1 single-field. Confidence 0.68.
Favor names where competitor authority high but competitor count low (pv13_com_rk_au / rel_num_comp). SUGGESTION1 applied with two fields. Confidence 0.66.
Use vec_range of customer PageRank to detect concentrated influential customer bases. SUGGESTION2 applied. Confidence 0.60.

results.idea: Competitor return momentum scaled by sector size
results.description: Normalize rel_ret_comp by sector company total (pv13_revere_company_total backfilled) to control sector crowding. SUGGESTION3 applied to pv13_revere_company_total due to low coverage. Confidence 0.58.
Rank instruments by partners' PageRank-weighted returns to find names with influential partner moves. SUGGESTION1 used pv13_com_page_rank and rel_ret_part. Confidence 0.67.
High kurtosis in rel_ret_comp indicates fat-tailed competitor moves worth exploiting. SUGGESTION1 single-field; used ts_kurtosis. Confidence 0.52.
Use persistent sign of customer returns (pv13_custretsig_retsig) over time to confirm trend. SUGGESTION1 single-field; used ts_sum of sign. Confidence 0.56.
Select top quantile of pv13_com_rk_au cross-sectionally and long those names. SUGGESTION1 single-field; used quantile operator. Confidence 0.70.

results.idea: Customer PageRank trend vs competitor returns
results.description: Detect divergence where customer PageRank increases but competitor returns lag. SUGGESTION1 used vec_avg(customer PageRank) and rel_ret_comp. SUGGESTION2 applied. Confidence 0.69.

results.idea: Competitor return momentum normalized by company cap
results.description: Normalize rel_ret_comp by pv13_revere_index_cap to prefer meaningful competitor moves. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.65.
When vec_avg customer PageRank falls but rel_ret_all spikes, take contrarian position. SUGGESTION1 used two fields; SUGGESTION2 applied. Confidence 0.60.
Estimate short half-life via ts_decay_linear and prefer names with persistent competitor moves. SUGGESTION1 single-field rel_ret_comp. Confidence 0.63.
Compute weighted stddev of competitor returns using pv13_com_rk_au as weights. SUGGESTION1 used two fields. Confidence 0.66.
Rapid increase in rel_num_part signals partnership-driven expansion. SUGGESTION1 single-field; used ts_delta. Confidence 0.55.

Long when both customer returns and partner returns move positive (consensus signal). SUGGESTION1 used rel_ret_cust (backfilled) and rel_ret_part. Applied SUGGESTION3 for rel_ret_cust. Confidence 0.62.
Within sector (pv13_revere_key_sector_total group) pick names with top pv13_com_page_rank via group_rank. SUGGESTION4 used fields with high counts and KEEP_IN_MIND4 applied. Confidence 0.68.
Detect when today's competitor returns are the max in lookback window - momentum continuation. SUGGESTION1 single-field rel_ret_comp. Confidence 0.59.
Winsorize vec_avg customer PageRank to limit outliers, then rank cross-sectionally. SUGGESTION2 applied. Confidence 0.60.
Divide competitor authority by competitor count to identify concentrated high-authority competitors. SUGGESTION1 used pv13_com_rk_au and rel_num_comp. Confidence 0.64.

High customer centrality (vec_avg) for small companies suggests disproportionate demand. SUGGESTION1 used vec_avg(pv13_ustomergraphrank_page_rank) and pv13_revere_index_cap. SUGGESTION2 applied. Confidence 0.70.

results.idea: Competitor return momentum after hub increase
results.description: When competitor hub rank rises and competitor returns follow, capture momentum. SUGGESTION1 used pv13_ompetitorgraphrank_hub_rank and rel_ret_comp. Confidence 0.66.
Use ts_ir on partner returns normalized by partner count to find sustained partner-driven returns. SUGGESTION1 used rel_ret_part and rel_num_part. Confidence 0.61.
High vec_stddev of customer hub rank indicates fragmented customer influence; potential alpha. SUGGESTION2 applied. Confidence 0.57.
Measure persistence with ts_product of small-window PageRank changes to prefer sustained increases. SUGGESTION1 single-field. Confidence 0.54.
If group_mean of rel_ret_all (by pv13_revere_key_sector_total) turns negative rapidly, avoid longs in that sector. SUGGESTION1 used group operator; KEEP_IN_MIND4 satisfied. Confidence 0.60.
Filter names where competitor authority grows but competitor returns remain weak — early leader signal. SUGGESTION1 used pv13_com_rk_au and rel_ret_comp. Confidence 0.65.
Combine customer PageRank vec_avg with customer hub vec_avg to create composite leadership metric. SUGGESTION2 applied to both vector fields. SUGGESTION1 used two fields. Confidence 0.72.
Use ts_rank over rel_ret_comp to prefer names with sustained high competitor returns. SUGGESTION1 single-field. Confidence 0.63.

Group-sum of pv13_com_page_rank weighted returns by sector group to find sector leaders. SUGGESTION1 used pv13_com_page_rank and rel_ret_all with group_cartesian_product not needed; instead group_sum not directly applicable to two inputs so kept simple: group_mean of weighted returns. KEEP_IN_MIND applied. Confidence 0.65.
Z-score of authority persistence via ts_zscore of ts_mean(pv13_com_rk_au). SUGGESTION1 single-field. Confidence 0.60.
Detect bursts in partner PageRank-weighted returns using ts_max_diff. SUGGESTION1 used rel_ret_part and pv13_com_page_rank. Confidence 0.59.

results.idea: Customer return vs competitor return momentum spread
results.description: Spread of ts_mean(rel_ret_cust backfilled) minus ts_mean(rel_ret_comp) to identify customer-led moves. SUGGESTION3 applied to rel_ret_cust. Confidence 0.64.
Cross-sectional quantile of pv13_com_rk_au to prioritize authoritative competitors. SUGGESTION1 single-field; used quantile. Confidence 0.66.
Group-neutralize vec_avg customer PageRank by pv13_revere_key_sector_total to find outliers within sector. SUGGESTION2 and 4 applied; KEEP_IN_MIND4 used group_neutralize. Confidence 0.69.
Rank names by ts_decay_linear of rel_ret_comp to favor persistent competitor moves. SUGGESTION1 single-field. Confidence 0.62.
Use vec_avg partner PageRank (pv13_com_page_rank) as proxy for partner influence; combine with partner returns. SUGGESTION1 used pv13_com_page_rank and rel_ret_part. Confidence 0.67.
Prefer names where customer return volatility (ts_std_dev of backfilled rel_ret_cust) is contracting. SUGGESTION3 applied. Confidence 0.55.
Long when competitor authority increases while customer sign is positive. SUGGESTION1 applied using pv13_com_rk_au and pv13_custretsig_retsig. Confidence 0.68.
Average rel_ret_all scaled by rel_num_all to prefer broad-based moves. SUGGESTION1 used both fields; both have high coverage. Confidence 0.70.
Cross-sectional zscore of rel_num_comp to detect under-competitive niches. SUGGESTION1 single-field; used zscore. Confidence 0.54.
Identify names where vec_avg customer PageRank's argmax occurs recently (ts_arg_max). SUGGESTION2 applied. Confidence 0.63.
Winsorize rel_ret_comp then take ts_zscore to reduce outliers. SUGGESTION1 single-field; used winsorize to reduce tail risk per KEEP_IN_MIND. Confidence 0.66.
Divide pv13_com_page_rank by rel_num_part to find highly-ranked firms with few partners (lean influence). SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.57.
Companies with many terminal sectors (pv13_revere_term_sector_total) and rising customer PageRank may outperform. SUGGESTION1 used two fields; coverage high. Confidence 0.60.

results.description: When pv13_revere_index_value drops and competitor PageRank increases, capture rotation. SUGGESTION1 used two fields. Confidence 0.61.
Use ts_arg_max on vec_avg customer hub rank to detect persistent increase. SUGGESTION2 applied. Confidence 0.59.
Calculate ts_ir for rel_ret_comp to find competitors with high information ratio. SUGGESTION1 single-field. Confidence 0.64.

results.idea: Customer PageRank scaled by company cap
results.description: Scale vec_avg customer PageRank by pv13_revere_index_cap to identify small companies with strong customer networks. SUGGESTION1 used two fields. Confidence 0.71.
Use ts_std_dev of rel_num_comp to identify unstable competitive landscapes and hedge accordingly. SUGGESTION1 single-field. Confidence 0.50.

results.idea: Customer PageRank vs competitor PageRank spread
results.description: Compute spread between vec_avg customer PageRank and competitor PageRank to find demand-led names. SUGGESTION1 used vec_avg(pv13_ustomergraphrank_page_rank) and pv13_com_page_rank. Confidence 0.68.
Use ts_zscore of rel_ret_all to identify persistent related-firm momentum. SUGGESTION1 single-field. Confidence 0.67.

results.idea: Competitor authority to company size ratio
results.description: Divide pv13_com_rk_au by pv13_revere_index_cap to surface disproportionately authoritative competitors. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.63.
Use ts_delta of vec_avg customer hub rank over 30 days to detect accelerating customer influence. SUGGESTION2 applied. Confidence 0.62.
Composite: zscore(rel_num_comp) * reverse(ts_zscore(rel_ret_comp)) to find crowded losers likely to mean-revert. SUGGESTION1 used two fields; compact implementation per KEEP_IN_MIND. Confidence 0.60.
Use vec_min and vec_max on customer PageRank vector to measure resilience (range) and prefer stable leaders. SUGGESTION2 applied. Confidence 0.58.
Signal only when competitor returns exceed positive threshold using if_else to reduce false positives. SUGGESTION1 single-field. Confidence 0.54.
Subtract partner PageRank-weighted returns from competitor PageRank-weighted returns to spot partner-driven divergence. SUGGESTION1 used rel_ret_part and pv13_com_page_rank. Confidence 0.60.
Require positive pv13_custretsig_retsig and positive rel_ret_comp momentum to validate signal. SUGGESTION1 used two fields; logical AND applied. Confidence 0.66.

results.idea: Authority persistence scaled by company count
results.description: Divide long-term mean of pv13_com_rk_au by pv13_revere_company_total (backfilled) to find concentrated authority. SUGGESTION3 applied to company_total. Confidence 0.56.
Second difference of pv13_com_page_rank to detect acceleration re-rates. SUGGESTION1 single-field; implemented via ts_delta of ts_delta. Confidence 0.61.
Find names with top vec_avg customer PageRank within sector group using group_rank. SUGGESTION2 and KEEP_IN_MIND4 applied. Confidence 0.70.
Use pasteurize on rel_ret_comp mean to remove inf/out-of-universe effects before ranking. SUGGESTION1 single-field; pasteurize reduces outliers per KEEP_IN_MIND. Confidence 0.58.
